body:
The current read only approach needs to be rethought - I have actually
been removing some of that code as I refactor things.  I would like to
discuss the best way of handling this at PyCon.  Until then I am -1 on
doing anything more with the current approach.

On Mon, Feb 6, 2012 at 9:02 AM, Bussonnier Matthias
reply@reply.github.com
wrote:

> This is more a reminder, but there are a lot of UI element that should be removed from read-only notebook.
> from the tip of my finger,
> - Conversion warning v2->v3 Â ( same for Print view)
> - Most of Menubar
> - Most of shortcut bar
> - ability to change the name.
> 
> BTW, is there any way to go to print view without saving ?

No, definitely not and with the limitations browsers have (blocking
popups) I don't think it will ever be possible.

> ---
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/1382

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

```
Until then I am -1 on doing anything more with the current approach.
```

That was just a reminder and a place to keep track of what to check.
For example one can still toggle cell type. And I suspect print view may one day maybe on sphynx. (?)

```
No, definitely not and with the limitations browsers have (blocking
popups) I don't think it will ever be possible.
```

What about clicking on print also trigger a saving to a temporary location (or even on object that stay inside Tornado, not a real file that clutter the disk) and that will be the one accessed throught the `/print` url ? 

Feel free to close if you prefer to keep the number of issues down.

I am going to close this one as the read-only design discussions will happen offline.  Once we know what we are going to go, we can open a new issue to track that work.

In terms of the print view, I think we really want to use the saved version and I don't think we want to trigger saves on print.  Those two actions should be orthogonal.  As we move to a version controlled/auto-saving setup, it will be even more the case the print will always use the likely-very-recently-saved version.  I don't want to break that model by trying to save to temp files that are not the real saved version.
